bakkot: Does your Matrix logger work by way of a bot on the channel that parses incoming messages?
Or does it instead parse the https://view.matrix.org/ logs/format?

content.body: Could anyone explain me what kind of difference between top-level browsing context and auxiliary browsing context?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Could anyone explain me what kind of difference between top-level browsing context and auxiliary browsing context?

content.body: Maxim Vaarwel: An auxiliary BC is a type of top-level BC. In particular it's one that was created via window.open() or target="_blank" or similar, i.e. there is an opener/openee relationship.
content.formatted_body: Maxim Vaarwel: An auxiliary BC is a type of top-level BC. In particular it's one that was created via window.open() or target="_blank" or similar, i.e. there is an opener/openee relationship.

Hello ! I have a question
I set up flask_cors on the server side, but still when I set up my extension to send POST request, this occurs
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I set up flask_cors on the server side, but still when I set up my extension to send POST request, this occurs

content.body: I have provided some additional images, I'm stuck at this for like a day, and I can't figure out why
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I have provided some additional images, I'm stuck at this for like a day, and I can't figure out why

content.body: Your options request should return an 200 OK status, not a 401
CORS preflight (OPTIONS) requests must return a 200 or 204 status code to be considered successful
Yeah, but how can I resolve the issue? it returns 401, because it needs an authorization header
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Yeah, but how can I resolve the issue? it returns 401, because it needs an authorization header

content.body: the preflight sends a request to see if they accept authorization as a header first with method : POST , before sending the actual POST request. Please correct me if I'm wrong but that's what I have understood
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the preflight sends a request to see if they accept authorization as a header first with method : POST , before sending the actual POST request. Please correct me if I'm wrong but that's what I have understood

content.body: You should not perform access control handling on the options request. The response to the options request should just indicate if the server is willing to process the real request at all, not if the real request will succeed or fail
I have handled it, thanks to your answer. I have reread your answer and understood what I should do
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I have handled it, thanks to your answer. I have reread your answer and understood what I should do

content.body: I have added an ( if not request.method == 'OPTIONS' ) and it worked
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I have added an ( if not request.method == 'OPTIONS' ) and it worked

content.body: Thank you again!
